items.sentence: Didn't Tom promise that he'd never do that?

I don't think that doing that will be easy.
I wonder why Tom isn't planning to do that.

I didn't even know that Tom had to do that.
Tom told me he thought Mary had to do that.
Tom said he's glad that you didn't do that.
Tom said he was glad that he could do that.
Tom said that he isn't planning to do that.
Tom admitted he didn't know how to do that.
I admitted I didn't really want to do that.

There's no doubt that Tom likes doing that.
I don't doubt Tom was the one who did that.

Tell everyone that we want to do that, too.
All three of those men have been in prison.
Tom spilled his wine on Mary's white dress.
I learned something very interesting today.
What should we three do tomorrow afternoon?
Don't ever let anybody tell you what to do.
I don't have to justify my decision to you.
I had to do something about that by myself.

Do you think that Tom is going to be there?
